intro: Miliusa ninhbinhensis, commonly known as the Ninh Binh miliusa, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly Vietnam, and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its fruit is a small, round drupe that changes color from green to red as it matures. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
